questions.question: That governments should not try to control economic decisions is an argument made by...

choices.answer: Adam Smith in The Wealth of Nations
Thomas Jefferson in The Declaration of Independence
John Locke in Two Treatises on Government
Baron de Montesquieu in The Spirit of the Laws

questions.question: The idea that life, liberty, and property are natural rights that governments should protect was developed by...
Who believed that the power of government should be divided among three branches?
The English Bill of Rights was the First document to place limits on the power of the English Monarchy.
How are the U.S. Declaration of Independence and the French Declaration of the Rights of Man similar?

choices.answer: Limited voting rights to only landowners
Established a republican form of government
Protected the natural rights of the people

questions.question: Which of the following sparked the French Revolution?

choices.answer: The Revolution that overthrew the tsars in Russia
Enlightenment ideas about natural rights and government
The Glorious Revolution in England and the English Bill of Rights
The great cultural achievements of the Renaissance

questions.question: The U.S. Constitution outlines a plan for government that has served as a model for new governments around the world?
The American Revolution was sparked by Humanist ideas.
That governments exist to protect the rights of the people is best reflected in which of the following documents?

choices.answer: Plato's  Republic and the Magna Carta
Magna Carta and the Declaration of the Rights of Man and of the Citizen
Declaration of Independence and Aristotle's  Politics
Declaration of Independence and the Declaration of the Rights of Man

questions.question: Which of the following was a cause of the American Revolution is addressed in the Declaration of Independence.
Which document best reflects the ideas of the Enlightenment?
Which event led to the use of science and reason, rather than tradition, to explain how the world works
What do Francis Bacon, Galileo, and William Harvey all have in common?

choices.answer: They were encouraged to publish their  findings by the church
They all were praised for their attempts to start revolutions
They all sought to remove academic and scientific ideas from education
They all used science to challenge accepted beliefs

questions.question: During the Scientific Revolution the Church suppressed scientists who challenged traditional ways of thinking.
The idea of Social Contract is that the King derives his authority from God.
What does Adam Smith mean when he says the government should have a laissez-faire role in the economy?

choices.answer: The government should stay out of regulating the economy
The government should place high taxes on the rich
The government should heavily regulate businesses
The government should control how people spend money

questions.question: Which of these people discovered the laws of motion and universal gravitation?
Which of the following is an example of an enlightenment idea?

choices.answer: People exist to serve the government
Citizens are born with natural rights

questions.question: Revolutions in France, Latin America, and Colonial America were inspired by the idea of "consent of the governed".
